sentences.en: a challenging and rewarding career as a teacher
sentences.cn: 富有挑战性且有意义的教师职业

sentences.en: And that's why watching him is so ever - amazing and ever - rewarding.
sentences.cn: 这也是为什么看他比赛是这么的令人惊讶和有意义.

sentences.en: Despite its length and convoluted plot, "Asta's Book" is a rich and rewarding read.
sentences.cn: 虽然篇幅很长，而且情节复杂，但是《阿斯塔的书》仍不失为一部内容丰富、值得一读的作品。

sentences.en: Gardening is a very rewarding pastime.
sentences.cn: 园艺劳动是非常有益的消遣.

sentences.en: I found it immensely rewarding working with the less able children.
sentences.cn: 为能力差的孩子工作我觉得是非常值得的.

sentences.en: In general, adverse reactions have occurred when insufficient attention has been given to rewarding desired behaviour.
sentences.cn: 一般讲, 这些副作用常出现于对良好行为未充分注意并及时给予奖励时.

sentences.en: Internet shopping can be a rewarding alternative to trudging through the stores.
sentences.cn: 网络购物会是除了在商家间奔波之外,另一项令人满意的选择.

sentences.en: It is a very rewarding exercise to work this out oneself.
sentences.cn: 独自解决这个问题是一次受益匪浅的锻炼。

sentences.en: Life for the successful doctor can be emotionally and financially rewarding.
sentences.cn: 对于事业有成的医生来说，生活在精神和物质两方面都能令人满足。

sentences.en: Running a television company may no longer be a licence to print money, but it is still highly rewarding.
sentences.cn: 经营电视公司也许不再是一本万利，但利润依然非常丰厚。

sentences.en: Saving lives and all must be real rewarding.
sentences.cn: 救人一类的事一定很值得称赞的.
她认为做母亲得偿所愿.

sentences.en: Sir George Staunton instantly wrote back an answer, rewarding the messager liberally.
sentences.cn: 乔治·斯汤顿爵士立即写了回信, 慷慨地犒赏了信差.

sentences.en: Sir George Staunton instantly wrote back an answer, rewarding the messenger liberally.
sentences.cn: 乔治?斯汤顿爵士立即写了回信, 慷慨地犒赏了信差.

sentences.en: Teaching can be a very rewarding career.
sentences.cn: 教书可以是一种很有意义的职业。

sentences.en: Teaching is not very rewarding financially , ie not very well paid.
sentences.cn: 教书的工作报酬不太高.

words.tran_cn: 有益的，值得的；有报酬的，报答的

phrases.tran_cn: 作为…的报酬；作为…的回报

trans.tran_en: making you feel happy and satisfied because you feel you are doing something useful or important, even if you do not earn much money
